    Class
    Description
    acb_dft_bluestein_struct

    Complex
    The complex numbers constitute an algebraically closed field, a commutative algebra over the reals, and a Euclidean vector space of dimension two.
    ComplexMatrix
     
    ComplexPartIterator
     
    ComplexPolynomial
     
    DirichletCharacter
     
    DirichletGroup
     
    DirichletPrimeGroup
     
    FastDFTScheme
     
    Field
    A field is a set on which addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division are defined and behave as the corresponding operations on rational and real numbers do.
    Float
    A Float contains four words:
    an fmpz exponent (exp) a size field tracking the number of limbs used (one bit of this field is also used for the sign of the number) and two more words
    If the precision is 128 bits or less then the last two (quad)words hold the value directly if there are at most two limbs, otherwise they contain one alloc field which tracks the total number of limbs allocated limbs, some of which can be unused, and a pointer to the actual limbs.
    The limit in arb is 64 bits on a 32bit machine but arb4j is recommended to be used on 64bit architecures (or better?) only
    FloatInterval
     
    FloatInterval.RootStatus
     
    GMPRandomState
     
    Integer
     
    Magnitude
     
    Mantissa

    OrthogonalBasis
     
    OrthogonalPolynomials
     
    RandomAlgorithm
     
    RandomAlgorithmData
     
    RandomState
     
    Real
    Real numbers are points on an infinitely long line known as the real number line, where the points corresponding to integers are equally spaced.
    RealMatrix
     
    RealRootInterval
     
    RealRootInterval.RefinementResult
     
    RootLocatorConfiguration
     
    Roots
    A resizeable array of RealRootIntervals and FloatInterval.RootStatuses
